intro: Dovea nuda, commonly known as the naked dove plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Dovea nuda is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
